title: NBA assistant believes Celtics will have NBA’s best player in 2030
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics "He's what everyone wishes they have: A 6-foot-10 guy who shoots 3s, gets to the rim and gets fouled.
" Jayson Tatum is on the mend from a ruptured Achilles tendon.
AP Photo/Charles Krupa Jayson Tatum is staring at a long road to recovery as he works his way back from a ruptured Achilles tendon.

title: Construction resumes on Cambridge bike path after temporary halt prompted by residents’ legal complaint
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Construction will begin after the city confirms an updated schedule with the contractor, the city “will make every effort to temporarily reopen the path once the base layer of pavement has been installed.
” A family makes their way down the Linear Park biker and pedestrian trail in August.

title: Tom Brady throws jab about Bill Belichick’s coaching style during TV broadcast
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I used to think, ‘I am gonna kill this guy.
Does he know how many Super Bowls I have won?
’" Tom Brady and Bill Belichick had an up-and-down relationship in Foxborough.

title: Former Patriots draft bust is emerging as top weapon for Patrick Mahomes
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "When I first got here, coming from New England, seeing these guys practice, man, they practice at a high level.
" Tyquan Thornton has established himself as a deep threat for Patrick Mahomes.
(AP Photo/Charlie Riedel) Tyquan Thrornton has been one of many top draft picks in recent memory who did not pan out with the Patriots.

title: Jaylen Brown honors Bill Nye at Hollywood Walk of Fame ceremony
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics "Thank you for changing the world, one dad joke and one science experiment at a time.

AP Photo/Chris Pizzello Longtime TV personality and scientific educator Bill Nye received his own star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame on Monday afternoon.

title: Scott Pioli has a candid take on Rhamondre Stevenson’s future with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "You're either going to learn how to hold onto the football, or someone else is going to have it, or you're going to be somewhere else.
" Rhamondre Stevenson is looking to bounce back after a two-fumble performance on Sunday.

Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 22, 2025 2 minutes to read Mike Vrabel and several Patriots players offered up support for Rhamondre Stevenson after the running back was knocked for a pair of fumbles during Sunday’s loss to the Steelers.

title: Activist Monica Cannon-Grant pleads guilty to federal fraud charges
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News In federal court Monday, Cannon-Grant pleaded guilty to 18 fraud-related charges, including conspiracy to commit wire fraud.
Former Boston community organizer Monica Cannon-Grant plead guilty to federal fraud charges at the John J.
Moakley Federal Courthouse in Boston on Monday.
